fr.sorbonne_u.datacenter.hardware.computers.ports

Class ComputerServicesInboundPort

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
      • java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
        • java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
          • fr.sorbonne_u.components.ports.AbstractPort
            • fr.sorbonne_u.components.ports.AbstractInboundPort
              • fr.sorbonne_u.datacenter.hardware.computers.ports.ComputerServicesInboundPort
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.ComponentServiceI, fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.OfferedI, fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.RequiredI, fr.sorbonne_u.components.ports.InboundPortI, fr.sorbonne_u.components.ports.PortI, ComputerServicesI, java.io.Serializable, java.rmi.Remote

    public class ComputerServicesInboundPort
extends fr.sorbonne_u.components.ports.AbstractInboundPort
implements ComputerServicesI
    The class ComputerServicesInboudPort implements an inbound port offering the ComputerServicesI interface.

    Description

    Invariant

     invariant              true

    Created on : April 9, 2015

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ComputerServicesInboundPort(fr.sorbonne_u.components.ComponentI owner) 
      ComputerServicesInboundPort(java.lang.String uri, fr.sorbonne_u.components.ComponentI owner) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Computer.AllocatedCore allocateCore()
      allocate one core on this computer and return an instance of AllocatedCore containing the processor number, the core number and a map giving the URI of the processor inbound ports; return null if no core is available.
      Computer.AllocatedCore[] allocateCores(int numberRequested)
      allocate up to numberRequested cores on this computer and return and array of AllocatedCore containing the data for each requested core; return an empty array if no core is available.
      void DeallocateCores(Computer.AllocatedCore[] vmcores, java.lang.String vmURI)
      deallocate the cores of a VM application.
      boolean DecreaseFrequency(Computer.AllocatedCore[] allocatedcore)
      this method is used to increase the frequency of the cores. allocatedCore[] is used to know the processor and the cores that request the increase of the frequency. the new frequency must be in the admissible frequencies and must not have a large difference between the frequencies of the cores of the same processor. this method uses a coordinator that allows to coordinate between all the applications that share the same processor
      int getAvailableCoresnumber()
      This method is called in order to update the computer cores status Contract pre true // no precondition.
      boolean IncreaseFrequency(Computer.AllocatedCore[] allocatedcore)
      this method is used to decrease the frequency of the cores. allocatedCore[] is used to know the processor and the cores that request the decrease of the frequency. the new frequency must be in the admissible frequencies and must not have a large difference between the frequencies of the cores of the same processor. this method uses a coordinator that allows to coordinate between all the applications that share the same processor
      void updateCoordinator(Computer.AllocatedCore[] allocatedCores, java.lang.String uriVM)
      updateCoordinator update the Coordinator list of ApplicationVM , the Coordinator have information about ApplicationVM which shares processors of the computer to coordinate between Applications

        allocate one core on this computer and return an instance of AllocatedCore containing the processor number, the core number and a map giving the URI of the processor inbound ports; return null if no core is available.

 post   true                    // no postcondition.

      • allocateCores

        public Computer.AllocatedCore[] allocateCores(int numberRequested)
                                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: ComputerServicesI
        allocate up to numberRequested cores on this computer and return and array of AllocatedCore containing the data for each requested core; return an empty array if no core is available.

        Contract

         pre    numberRequested > 0
 post   return.length >= 0 and return.length <= numberRequested
        Specified by:
        allocateCores in interface ComputerServicesI
        Parameters:
        numberRequested - number of cores to be allocated.
        Returns:
        an array of instances of AllocatedCore with the data about the allocated cores.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - todo.
        See Also:
        ComputerServicesI.allocateCores(int)

                            java.lang.String vmURI)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: ComputerServicesI
        deallocate the cores of a VM application. This method receives in parameter an AllocatedCore [] in order to know the cores and the processors already reserved.

        Contract

 post   true                    // no postcondition.

      • IncreaseFrequency

        public boolean IncreaseFrequency(Computer.AllocatedCore[] allocatedcore)
                          throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: ComputerServicesI
        this method is used to decrease the frequency of the cores. allocatedCore[] is used to know the processor and the cores that request the decrease of the frequency. the new frequency must be in the admissible frequencies and must not have a large difference between the frequencies of the cores of the same processor. this method uses a coordinator that allows to coordinate between all the applications that share the same processor
        Specified by:
        IncreaseFrequency in interface ComputerServicesI
        Parameters:
        allocatedcore - AllocatedCore[] in order to know the cores for frequency increase
        Returns:
        status of DecreaseFrequency

        java.lang.Exception
